images.caption: Figure 1:Comparison of unconstrained self-evolution and our structured self-evolution.

Figure 2:Overview of the EvoFSM framework. Our approach consists of three core components:
(1) FSM Initialization, which formalizes the research process as a dynamic finite state machine initialized from prior experiences;
(2) Structured Self-Evolution, which employs atomic operations to precisely optimize both the system‚Äôs skill operators (ùí™s‚Äãk‚Äãi‚Äãl‚Äãl\mathcal{O}_{skill}) and flow operators (ùí™f‚Äãl‚Äão‚Äãw\mathcal{O}_{flow}) based on critic feedback; and
(3) Self-Evolving Memory Mechanism, which distills successful and failure trajectories into an experience pool to facilitate continuous learning and warm-starting for future tasks.
Figure 3:Transferability study on the ALFWorld and WebShop benchmarks. We compare the success rate (a) and average reasoning steps (b) of each method.
Figure 4:Effect of number of iterations on accuracy in the Bamboogle and DeepSearch benchmarks.
